summary: This function determines whether a predicate is true for all the elements in an iterable.
returns: True is returned, iff the predicate is true for all the elements.
throws: in order to propagate exceptions caused by the predicate.
example-1: module Main in execution;%0A%0A@Start%0Adefun main (args : String[]) : void%0A{%0A    # Creates some lists. %0A    val list1 = [1, 2, 3, 2, 1, 2, 3, 2, 1];%0A    val list2 = [9, 8, 7, 8, 9, 8, 7, 8, 9];%0A    val list3 = [9, 8, 7, 8, 3, 8, 7, 8, 9];%0A%0A    # Create a predicate.%0A    lambda p : Predicate => ($1 is Integer) < 5;%0A%0A    # Are all the values below five?%0A    val test1 = F::all(list1, p);%0A    val test2 = F::all(list2, p);%0A    val test3 = F::all(list3, p);%0A%0A    # Print the results.%0A    F::println(test1);%0A    F::println(test2);%0A    F::println(test3);%0A}
